Supplier Diversity

Ribble Valley's HHI score of 170.8 indicates low supplier concentration — the second-best score in Lancashire after Lancaster. No single supplier dominates spending, with the largest (Lancashire County Council at £844,700) receiving just 7.4% of total expenditure.

Local Suppliers

For a rural borough, the diversity of suppliers is notable. The 672 unique suppliers range from major national companies (Zurich Insurance, Dennis Eagle) to parish councils and local businesses. This spread suggests the council is accessible to smaller providers.

Insurance Costs

Zurich Insurance is the second-largest supplier at £607,500 — representing 5.3% of total spend. For a council of Ribble Valley's size, this is a significant insurance cost and worth benchmarking against similar-sized rural authorities.

See the full supplier analysis on our DOGE Investigation page.
